intro: Triplophyllum, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, primarily native to southern and eastern Africa. These plants are herbaceous perennials, often characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and showy, spathaceous inflorescences. The flowers are typically green or yellowish and are surrounded by a leaf-like bract. Triplophyllum species are adapted to a variety of habitats, including rocky soils and woodlands.
